title: Sometimes showing blank white page on the screen
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

In the latest version of Streamlit (1.37.0), st.tabs loads blank page. The nature of this error is transient. I am not sure what is going on but when it loads a blank page. I give the errors in the browser's console. Sometimes the same code works fine but sometimes it loads a blank page.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
# loading some data in session

tab1, tab2, tab3 = st.tabs(["1", "2", "3"])
    with tab1:
        st.info('Some info in tab1.')
    with tab2:
        st.info('Some info in tab2.')
    with tab3:
        st.info('Some info in tab3.')
```


### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

It should load the tabs I have defined with the design for each tab.

### Current Behavior

It loads the data but when try to execute st.tabs snippet, it gives an error in the browser's console. I have attached a screenshot

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61ea05f6-2785-414e-affe-67767537d2a9)


### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.37.0
- Python version: 3.10.12
- Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04 
- Browser: Firefox and Chrome


### Additional Information

